result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos J Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ordered in the amount of $2,000.00 to Gregory P. - to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Gregory P., Benjamin L., or their families or their residences.
Write letter of apology to victms. (Gregory P., Benjamin L.)
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Cases 14CF1144, 15CT1144 and 15CT528 was dismissed and read into: 14CF296 and 15CF1039.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Carlos J Erickson in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (consecutive to any other sentence).
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Gregory P. and Benjamin L.,  their families or their residences.
*Write letter of apology to victims Gregory P. and Benjamin L.  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $2,000.00 payable to Gregory P.  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
